author: Special Correspondent
text:
The State Department of Art and Culture will conduct classical vocal, bharathanatyam, folk dance and drawing competitions for school students at Government Music School at Thalavaipatti here on February 5. Students studying in Standard VI to XI are eligible to take part in the competitions. The students will be competing in categories – junior level: students of Standard VI and VII; senior level: students of Standard VIII to XI.

Vocal, music, bharathanatyam and folk dance competitions have been scheduled at 10 a.m. and on-the-spot drawing competition will be held at 2 p.m. Those who are learning advance-level classical vocal can participate in vocal competition, but they should sing only Tamil composition.

Bharathanatyam and folk dance competitors must avoid film songs and group dance. In folk section, traditional style such as karagam, kavadi, thappattam, oyilattam and poikal kuthirai will be encouraged.

A release from B. Hemanathan, regional assistant director of Department of Art and Culture, issued here on Wednesday said that the first prize winners would participate in State level competition. For further details, interested students can contact Head Master, Government Music School, at 0427-2386975.
title: Competitions for school students
